Key Arguments: The legislation is compared to a totalitarian regime as depicted in George Orwell's '1984', suggesting it will lead to a loss of freedom and personal autonomy.
The author believes that the legislation will ultimately be used against those who support it, as history shows that systems of control often turn on their creators.
The submission argues that the bill contradicts fundamental Australian values such as freedom of speech, personal responsibility, and community governance.
The author warns that the legislation could lead to a society where past actions are judged by future, potentially more extreme standards, leading to unjust consequences.
Main Themes: Personal autonomy and freedom of speech
Distrust of government and elite control
Notable Quotes: '1984 by George Orwell was supposed to be a warning, not an instruction manual.'
'You may think youâ€™re doing the right thing now, but history tells the truth.'
'Stop this ever-increasing slide into bumbling, incoherent, micromanaged totalitarian fascism because history shows where it ends, every time.'
